skill.name: cosmic-database
skill.description: Access COSMIC cancer mutation database. Query somatic mutations, Cancer Gene Census, mutational signatures, gene fusions, for cancer research and precision oncology. Requires authentication.
skill.summary: Access COSMIC cancer mutation database. Query somatic mutations, Cancer Gene Census, mutational sign...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: All 121 static findings are false positives. The analyzer misidentified markdown code fences (```) as shell backticks, documentation URLs as network threats, and fabricated cryptographic patterns. This is a legitimate Sanger Institute bioinformatics tool. The Python script only makes authenticated HTTPS requests to download cancer genomics data from the official COSMIC database.

low_findings.title: Hardcoded COSMIC API URL
low_findings.description: Hardcoded COSMIC API URL for legitimate data access

low_findings.title: HTTP requests to COSMIC API
low_findings.description: HTTP requests to COSMIC API for authenticated file downloads

low_findings.title: File writing for database files
low_findings.description: File writing to save downloaded COSMIC database files

content.value_statement: Cancer researchers need comprehensive mutation data for studies. This skill provides programmatic access to the COSMIC database containing millions of somatic mutations, curated cancer gene lists, and mutational signatures for precision oncology research.
actual_capabilities: Download mutation data from COSMIC database using authenticated access
Query Cancer Gene Census for curated lists of 700+ cancer genes
Retrieve mutational signature profiles for signature analysis workflows
Access structural variants, gene fusions, and copy number alterations
Download drug resistance mutations with clinical annotations
Support both GRCh37 and GRCh38 genome assemblies
limitations: Requires free academic registration at Sanger Institute
Commercial use requires QIAGEN license agreement
Data files can be several gigabytes in size
COSMIC updates quarterly - specific versions needed for reproducibility

use_cases.title: Analyze mutation patterns
use_cases.description: Download somatic mutations data to identify recurrent mutations in specific cancer types for research studies.

use_cases.title: Build annotation pipelines
use_cases.description: Integrate COSMIC data into bioinformatics workflows to annotate patient variants with cancer significance.

use_cases.title: Research drug resistance
use_cases.description: Query resistance mutation data to inform precision medicine decisions for cancer treatment.

prompt_templates.title: Download mutations
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to download the Cancer Gene Census from COSMIC using the download_cosmic.py script. What filepath should I use?

prompt_templates.title: Query by gene
prompt_templates.prompt: What file contains TP53 mutations in COSMIC and how do I filter the downloaded data for a specific gene?

prompt_templates.title: Mutational signatures
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I download and work with COSMIC mutational signatures? What file paths should I use for SBS signatures?

prompt_templates.title: Integrate with VCF
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to read a downloaded CosmicCodingMuts.vcf.gz file using pysam and extract records for chromosome 17.

output_examples.input: Download the Cancer Gene Census from COSMIC
output: Contains 700+ curated cancer genes with roles (oncogene, TSG, fusion)
Downloaded file can be read with pandas.read_csv()

output_examples.input: Find TP53 mutations in lung cancer
output: Found 847 TP53 mutations in lung cancer samples

best_practices: Use GRCh38 assembly for new projects and specify genome_assembly='GRCh38' in function calls
Use 'latest' in file paths to get the most recent COSMIC release or pin specific versions for reproducibility
Store credentials securely using environment variables and never hardcode passwords in scripts
anti_patterns: Using GRCh37 for new projects when GRCh38 is the current standard reference genome
Downloading the entire database when specific subsets meet your analysis needs
Skipping authentication verification before attempting downloads

faq.question: Is COSMIC access free?
faq.answer: Academic users get free access with registration. Commercial users need a QIAGEN license.

faq.question: What genome assembly should I use?
faq.answer: Use GRCh38 for new projects. GRCh37 is available for legacy pipeline compatibility.

faq.question: How large are COSMIC files?
faq.answer: Mutation files can be several gigabytes. The script shows download progress for large files.

faq.question: What file formats are available?
faq.answer: TSV, CSV, and VCF formats. TSV and CSV use gzip compression. VCF is standard for variant data.

faq.question: How often is COSMIC updated?
faq.answer: COSMIC is updated quarterly. Use 'latest' in file paths for the most current version.

faq.question: Can I use this with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes, COSMIC data integrates with VEP, pysam, pandas, and standard bioinformatics pipelines.
